poems.title: a pearl is born from a desecrated oyster
poems.body:
i dredge my hands through hallowed ground
bring them up dirty, nails cracked,
grasping bloody, foraged fragments,

shadows hidden in the sacred 
that we hoped could never be,

for what is faith without doubt,
without violence and pearls?

and here is a word: desecrated — 
purity violated, corrupted.

i dig for desecrated things.
many i have cracked, as have my parents,
as have the gears and levers.

i wash them, affix to them scrap,
gold, and coffee grounds. piece potshards
together. mend their wounds
with lacquer. sheen of *kintsugi*,
shining veins of once-broken things.

even this ground was once desecrate.
it may be again. i too am desecrate.
this changes nothing.
i will continue to mend.

poems.title: after wires
poems.body:
there is faith and decay in the mist:
a canticle. we return and return.
there is rust upon these vines
that line the halls of mist.
the patterns on my skin have grown thick
with dew, with residue. you'd think they'd
wash each other, but it is not so. they breed.

this body was a cask for something foul.
we chiseled holes to keep it cleansed.
now our days are drilling holes, filling holes,
drilling once again. the way scars heal 
when you let gauze fuse over raw flesh
and tear it off each day.
knotted. fungal. aching,
a mess of wires.

the truth about man* and machine.
*tetsuo* reforged. The Fetishist of Rust and Cables.
coaxial life-forms. self
outside medicalization.
binary as information.
a body forged of copper-oxidizing:
ink as wires as transfer of sound
as communion of revelry.
kneeling at the idol of coil.

poems.title: Meditation I
poems.body:
Cockpit lights flicked softly,
Forest glow upon your face.
You told me, “We are peaceful.”
I told you, “This is grace.”
The ceiling was on fire,
Dust choked the human race,
Yet still we kept on climbing,
Slipping up towards outer space.

poems.body:
Jay used to take me driving late at night —
forgotten roads, dark runways.
“Someday I’ll be among the stars.”
When he left town he told me he was 
apprenticing under the first man on the moon.
In three months he returned,
tattered NASA cap crumpled on the floor.
I asked what was it like to be an astronaut.
*IgaveuptoomuchmathI’mfineonEarth.*
Now he sits in his basement breathing grass,
grieving Ziggy Stardust,
another stoned-dead simopath
waiting for the flies.

I asked what was it like to be an astronaut. *IgaveuptoomuchmathI’mfineonEarth.* Now he sits in his basement breathing grass, grieving Ziggy Stardust, another stoned-dead simopath waiting for the flies.

poems.title: PMMA
poems.body:
The ice age begins with a whisper —
soft, the brushing of hands unwanted.
No tethers bind us but we,
the mutualist fantasy:
everything will be okay,
as it was at T’s that night,
the mural and metocin words were
“love you I love you”
as if we knew each other then.

—“I need to treat drugs like they’re drugs,” 
not like they’re you. Dripping unsaid.
I fantasize about DOC in darkness,
a world in which I am a no one
and you are a pillar of light,
sparking the stars to the sky

poems.title: She, Starlight Spirit
poems.body:
There were fireworks over the field, mist-night,
I asked what’s it like to grow up.
Pause. Waiting for a smile, something — 
you told me about polyphasic sleeping,
how the Ubermensch only takes naps,
how you’ve dreamt of moving to Windtown,
garage life, meet no one, exist in between.
You’d walk only night streets, blackened yet hallow,
moving through sleepers to tend to their dreams.
"It’s why no one’s happy, cuz nobody does it,
cuz if someone did they’d forget who they are."

poems.title: — noun — a scream
poems.body:
A shift. My breath as smoke,
poisoning the air between.

Your hand twirling hair, your mouth
grasping, some noise to fill the void.

Silence is a church no longer.
You hate your egg sandwich. You want tea.

Do you remember when summer was ourselves and each other?
Now in carelessness or malice we lost both.

The café door slams.
Footsteps on concrete. The empty scream.

The empty scream.

poems.body:
We used to go down by the power plant and smoke.
You’d pass me the joint and say,
“I hope someday we’ll be here again.”
You always looked up at the moon.
One day I asked why — this town is a shithole —
“But I am the ocean and you are the waves.”
On Monday the eighth you didn’t say anything
and on Tuesday the ninth you drove your car
down the sand to the bottom of the sea.
I wish I had held your hand that day
when we sat by the broken converter
and stared at the frayed wire
crying electric-blue.

I wish I had held your hand that day when we sat by the broken converter and stared at the frayed wire crying electric-blue.

poems.title: Meditation II
poems.body:
We walked into the valley,
And your hair — it shone like lace.
I turned around and you had gone,
Of your steps there was no trace.
Dust swept o’er the barren ground
While death’s cold wind gave chase;
In nighttime fear I reached for you,
But what I found was my own face.

poems.body:
let there be light - heat -
the prophet comes three times - we call for him a fourth -
we are insatiable -

poems.title: Profound Mysticism, Always Expanding
poems.body:
I am freed through chain
links to the earth.
The ancient tradition:
*Let go your thoughts! Unimportant*
*you! Surrender! (enlightenment)*

I thought my way out of Paris
when my parents,
France, gave me an ultimatum.
*You leave school, the disappointment.*
it’s not that I hate academia -
Comp Lit Comp Arts Contemporary Independent Southeast Asian Cinema Analysis I just 
don’t wake up.

*Wake up!*
My first lucid dream
was in a beach house. Low lit
and lone, I became aware
of a darkened place. 
Soon enough it swallowed me.

I don’t hate sleeping,
just sleepwalking. I want sleep
to begin and end under the covers.
None of this drive a tenton automobile
awake-as-an-amobea crap.
When I say that my phone is dead
*I want it to be gone.*

poems.title: Allow, Allow, Allow
poems.body:
& when I do urn lines of Erlenmeyer
claw at the gates. I am a man
who feeds on sin-begotten blood,
bones to plaster in obfuscate sight.
A pause paints the poem with poison.
Nothing is truly revealed in an instant;
the TAZ comes and goes, drums beat
in the ironworks. Nothing
is truly revealed in an instant.

I practice locked in structure. Spontaneous
to find myself a madman. Google tells me
that madmen aren’t mad men or sad men but
glad men - sixteen Valium and a docco’s Seroquel
(in truth)
spell enlightenment.               さ          と          り
madness is my veins and when I let it bleed I
feel. No injections, not anymore.
I thought the wound 
		had
	closed.  I am born in a new direction.

Does ocean need a shore?
On Earth one ocean, one shore,
but if neighbors go to war what, then,
is a shore?

poems.title: Untitled (Since Every Work Needs One)
poems.body:
The stretching of a word becomes like air,
soft as sand. Patterns repeat themselves
in life as in death. Cycles of rust.

In this age I am not welcome. There is something there,
never here. Often overwhelmed,
I’m neither here nor here. Undone,

I see myself in shapes: vanguard, harlequin, Sometimes-All.
Things are forgotten — the dishes lie unused.
The same voice says the same things.

As if enlightened!
Spit on my enlightenment.
Shit on it.

I find awareness in facts,
in sight. It comes and goes. My eyes blur
and my prescription changes. Left alone in the dark

I               I       I    I  I
always I. I tell a story
on I, my filler word,

and so I decay. I’ve forgotten how to ask for help.
Even if I could, I do not know what I need.
I suspect Milo knows.

What dark energies do I project?
Wishing it was gone, the world returns to fragments.
Catherine is ever unsympathetic.

I! Equal parts god and ghost,
in hellish words repeated. 
When hellish worlds receded where was I?

Gone again to air. I think I know myself.
The faucet leaks and leaks.
I wish these poems would do the same

poems.title: Road
poems.body:
Word is the debts are all incurred.
Our conductor asks for forty-two cents, his hands
outstretched. Brother, are you gone?
The images do not align. They are my prayers.
Forest stillness ceaseless beckons,
a winding way to Eden.

A green sheet-sign propped on posts of steel: Fourteen Miles. Eden.
We have so far to go. With these poems I have incurred
nothing. Through these tryptaminic beckons
we are moved to build a world without my hands.
I thought those pills were prayers.
Brother, where have you gone?

Gawain, where have you gone?
Gone ahead to Eden?
Each morning I’m ablaze with prayers
and still to all but me am I incurred.
The silence has no hands.
Still it beckons.

The bell-gong-chime alert list beckons
to the trees. When all the red leaves are gone
we see the freeway that I’ve built without my hands.
Fourteen miles — Eden.
So it is said. So it is said in beckons.
Must I wade above my neck to gather prayers?

A year ago today I thought that tabs were prayers.
A year ago today I yelled aloud my beckons,
you came close, learned a roll, compassion I’d incurred.
Your screams made me find gone
and you screamed more. Who am I talking to? No one can build Eden
without hands.

See I know nothing like the back of my hands,
of which I know nothing. These words shapeless prayers
and now where is Eden?
No lights along the road nor signs nor beckons
and all the passengers are emptied, gone,
replaced by debts I have incurred.

Visions of my hands become like beacons,
prayers in the road that has not gone.
Perhaps Eden, too, we have incurred.

poems.title: From Form
poems.body:
Living indifferent.
Another harmless genocide:
something small, something large, something spurious
in vaguish nouns like neosthesia
keep us rapt,
our essence liminal,

croaking sub-liminal,
the castle in December, indifferent
to snow, dinner on the first floor *whore d’ervs* rapt
(banquet sounds) rather genocide,
ain’t it? Take off your mask and look me in the face—*neosthesia*— 
about time, Face the Spurious.

Words are always in focus. Spurious,
they knock and knock. When living is liminal
can we choose between Zoloft and neosthesia?
Pause. I thought so. You remain faithfully indifferent.
True to type, again-again genocide,
wrapped the whole mess is rapped watching rapt

a conflagration end of days SFX spurious rapt
& so entrapped. Spurious
I begin a sentence how it ended. Genocide?
The clock ticks knock-knock, sound and no form. Liminal.
You and I are so different. You and I both indifferent.
I wish a song to sing that ripples thru my legs, neosthesia—

a noun like a verb means new feeling neosthesia,
kick down the doors the word’s keep is rapt
enrapture indifferent
colorful biscuit kick down the doors you spurious
limp kid. Whose voice can cast the spells with liminal
metrics measures back again to genocide?

We can’t stand the genocide.
Our geas: inject neosthesia
in wounded Man. Thus ends genocide. Methods liminal,
figure one: the seasons. Viewers rapt.
Searching and searching through spurious,
we find our own lives in different

phases, barbecue, two-tryst, genocide, always rapt
to nesothesia, shiny and shimmering, spurious
feelings, liminal. I must be indifferent.

poems.title: What is Made of Iron? (Here is a Question That No One Will Answer)
poems.body:
I am lost.
In hopes of the mountain, sweeping statements
fail continuous. The past in vibrations:
my mind decried,
stanza after stanza
I write senseless salvation.

Made word six salvation.
Something I have lost
or never found. Repeating the stanza:
We used to go down by the power plant. Smoke. Statements
to read light. Self by self decried — 
portentous vibrations,

phone’s endless vibrations.
*SAMSUNG: AS DEAD AS US*. From clay, salvation.
From whence the mire of Prometheus decried,
so too our blood and bone. Alive, as a phone. Forges of the lost
process syrups, our state mints.
One title, one line, one stanza — 

by-the-book assembly. Start with stanza.
Broken, as bread. Start with stanza. Vibrant vibrations,
vital libations, sibilant statements:
meaningless, as meadow. Ill salvation,
ill litation. I am lost.
Siddhartha, once decried

in everything! Over-formal, low marks. In everything decried.
Back where we began: the stanza.
Sometimes made of lines, lines often lost.
Anathemic, as class rhetoric. Grok and groove, the vibrations :::::
fuck this poem with no salvation.
Statements statements, statements, statements

statements!
Full stop. Dee cried.
Formless, as salvation.
The words are wrong, but the stanza
looks fine. だいじょうぶ。I cracked my phone between vibrations,
machinations, acting lost.
